metadata.Title: CVE-2019-3466 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The pg_ctlcluster script in postgresql-common in versions prior to 210 didn't drop privileges when creating socket/statistics temporary directories, which could result in local privilege escalation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3466` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

postgresql-client-common - 154ubuntu1.1+esm1
postgresql-common - 154ubuntu1.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

postgresql - 154ubuntu1.1+esm1
postgresql-client - 154ubuntu1.1+esm1
postgresql-contrib - 154ubuntu1.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: postgresql-common package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '154ubuntu1.1+esm1').
postgresql-common package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '154ubuntu1.1+esm1').
